title: Regulation of the mammalian-brain V-ATPase through ultraslow mode-switching
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05472-9

Single-molecule measurements of synaptic vesicles show that V-ATPases do not pump continuously in time but instead stochastically switch between ultralong-lived proton-pumping, inactive and proton-leaky modes.

title: The encoding of touch by somatotopically aligned dorsal column subdivisions
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05470-x

Distinct subdivisions of low-threshold mechanoreceptors and postsynaptic dorsal column neurons converge at the dorsal column nuclei to code precise tactile representations.

title: Anomalous thermal transport under high pressure in boron arsenide
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05381-x

Competition between three- and four-phonon scattering processes is shown to be the source of a unique anomalous thermal conductivity in boron arsenide at high pressures.

title: MYC multimers shield stalled replication forks from RNA polymerase
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05469-4

MYC dissociation from active promoters alters its interactions with proteins involved in transcription termination and RNA processing, influencing DNA repair and thus, potentially, tumour cell growth.

title: Structured cerebellar connectivity supports resilient pattern separation
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05471-w

Mapping of the mouse cerebellar cortex using 3D reconstruction from electron microscopy, as well as numerical simulation of neuronal activity, shows non-random redundancy of connectivity that may favour resilient learning over encoding capacity.

title: Emergent charge order in pressurized kagome superconductor CsV<sub>3</sub>Sb<sub>5</sub>
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05351-3

The evolution of CDW and superconductivity with pressure in CsV3Sb5 by 51V NMR measurements shed new light on the interplay of superconductivity and CDW, revealing new electronic correlation effects in kagome superconductors AV3Sb5.

title: Spin cross-correlation experiments in an electron entangler
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05436-z

Spin correlation experiments are demonstrated in an electron entangler device based on the ‘splitting’ of Cooper pairs from a superconductor, which can potentially be used to investigate many fundamental phases and processes related to the electron spin.

title: Distributed quantum sensing with mode-entangled spin-squeezed atomic states
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05363-z

A spatially distributed, atomic clock network entangled via quantum nondemolition measurements offers better precision and lower noise compared to an equivalent mode-separable network, and the improvements scale with network size.

title: Polarized blazar X-rays imply particle acceleration in shocks
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/s41586-022-05338-0

Polarization measurements are reported for the blazar Mk501, revealing a degree of X-ray polarization that is more than twice the optical value and supporting the shock-accelerated energy-stratified electron population scenario.

title: Folate transporter offers clues for anticancer drugs
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/d41586-022-03767-5

Structural insights into a long-studied folate-transport protein provide evidence that might lead to entirely new targeted anticancer treatments, or boost the success of immunotherapy approaches to tackling tumours.

title: How two intermingled sensory pathways combine to encode touch
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/d41586-022-03614-7

Touch signals from the skin are carried to the brain by intermingled projections of two pathways in the spinal cord. These pathways convey distinct features of tactile stimuli, and converge differentially on brainstem neurons that direct different aspects of touch to various brain regions.

title: A proton-pumping enzyme in the brain switches between modes
description:
Nature, Published online: 23 November 2022; doi:10.1038/d41586-022-03617-4

The enzyme V-ATPase pumps protons into vesicles at the synaptic connections between neuronal cells, and is crucial for neuronal communication. Observations of individual V-ATPase molecules reveal that they randomly switch between proton-pumping, rest and leaking modes, which each last for several minutes, with potential implications for neurotransmission.
